page.title: 17BENENDEN WEALD, FOUR WENTS.
page.content: The timber framed house at Four Wents is a prominent local landmark, standing opposite the grass triangle at the cross roads, and is the home of one of the sons of Forest Farm and his family. It was at one time a pub and shows the typical wealden jetting of the upstairs. The porch proudly proclaims 1681 in a pattern of black and white triangles in the plaster, but this probably only tells of one of the many phases of modernisation. Parts of the structure are local sandstone blocks, but the main infilling between the closely spaced timbers is wattle and daub. Some has recently been renewed and is a sunny warm ochre. Inside it is the details such as the wooden latches with their leather thongs and the combed pattern in the attic plaster that linger in ones mind.
